pullRequest.body:
Define the completed L-function for a function on `ZMod N`, and prove its functional equation.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [e6c928c60e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16894/commits/e6c928c60e0d022062696bb540efd4ebcf375f8e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ LFunction_apply_zero_of_even`
`+ LFunction_def_even`
`+ LFunction_def_odd`
`+ LFunction_eq_completed_div_gammaFactor_even`
`+ LFunction_eq_completed_div_gammaFactor_odd`
`+ LFunction_neg_two_mul_nat_add_one`
`+ LFunction_neg_two_mul_nat_sub_one`
`+ completedLFunction`
`+ completedLFunction_def_even`
`+ completedLFunction_def_odd`
`+ completedLFunction_eq`
`+ completedLFunction_modOne_eq`
`+ completedLFunction_one_sub_even`
`+ completedLFunction_one_sub_odd`
`+ completedLFunction_zero`
`+ completedLFunction₀`
`+ differentiableAt_completedLFunction`
`+ differentiable_completedLFunction`
`+ differentiable_completedLFunction₀`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> This is great, thanks!
> 
> Can you please split this in 3 PRs with:
> 
> * the addition to `EvenFunction` (this can be merged very quickly)
> * the stylistic modifications you made to `LSeries.ZMod` (again can be merged very quickly)
> * the main one.
> 
> Feel free to ask my review.

Thanks for the feedback! I have split off #16911 for the material on even/odd functions, and I will do another PR shortly for the stylistic changes / refactors of existing results in `LSeries.ZMod`.
OK, here's a new version, reworked and substantially shortened based on your feedback – many thanks once again for looking at this!

:v: loefflerd can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review! 

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10947209107/job/30395431665)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10947209107/job/30395432226)

Thanks!

bors d+

This is great, thanks!

Can you please split this in 3 PRs with:
* the addition to `EvenFunction` (this can be merged very quickly)
* the stylistic modifications you made to `LSeries.ZMod` (again can be merged very quickly)
* the main one.

Feel free to ask my review.

Thanks!

bors d+
The doc is slightly different from the actual statement.
Same.

```suggestion
open HurwitzZeta Complex ZMod Finset Classical Topology Filter Set
```
Should be the same.
Maybe `simp`?
`simp`?
Same.
Again this can be `simp` (unless it can already prove it).
Maybe this and various other lemms can be called `Even.blahbla` to have dot notation.

I'm not so keen on using dot-notation for these, because I thought it was better to keep everything together in the `ZMod` namespace. These results make sense only for functions `ZMod N → ℂ` while `Function.Even` is much more general.
OK, no problem.

```suggestion
The completed L-function of a function `ZMod 1 → ℂ` is a scalar multiple of the completed Riemann zeta
```
Can you add a `rfl` lemma that can be rewritten, instead of using `unfold`?
It's difficult to do that when the goal involves an un-applied function, but I have now changed the definitions a bit anyway so the comment no longer applies.
We usually state two lemmas instead of one using an `Or`, but I don't think this is too strict, especially if it gives a lot of code duplication (same below).

I thought about this, and realised that the duplication would not actually be so bad, because the proof is far easier and shorter for odd functions than even ones (you don't have to mess around so much with possible poles). So I have split it into two separate lemmas for the odd / even cases.

```suggestion
lemma differentiableAt_completedLFunction (Φ : ZMod N → ℂ) (s : ℂ) (hs₀ : s ≠ 0 ∨ Φ 0 = 0)
    (hs₁ : s ≠ 1 ∨ ∑ j, Φ j = 0) : DifferentiableAt ℂ (completedLFunction Φ) s := by
```
I found it nicer, but do as you prefer.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/LSeries): completed L-functions
